main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tse.crypto

Class ECDSA

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tse.crypto.SignatureAlgorithm
      • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tse.crypto.ECDSA

  • public class ECDSA
extends SignatureAlgorithm
    The class that implements signature creation with the ECDSA. It uses the BouncyCastle library to sign and verify signatures, although the verification functionality is not used in the context of the TSE simulator for anything but testing.
    Used by CryptoCore
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    dpottkaemper
    See Also:
    SignatureAlgorithm}

    • Constructor Detail

      • ECDSA

        public ECDSA()
      throws java.io.IOException
        The new default constructor for ECDSA objects that gets called by CryptoCore if ECDSA is the desired SignatureAlgorithm. This method relies on the file config.properties to determine the format of the private key and the directory this file is stored in. It fetches the private key and uses it to calculate the public key. Then it saves both values for later use in sign(byte[]) and verify(byte[], byte[]).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading the private key file fails and/or accessing config.properties through PropertyValues fails.
        Since:
        1.4

    • Method Detail

      • readKeyPair

        private static org.bouncycastle.openssl.PEMKeyPair readKeyPair(java.io.File privateKey)
                                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                                               ECCException
        A little method to help extract a key pair from a pem file. If the private key file that was passed did not contain enough information to form a PEMKeyPair, a method extracting the private and the public key separately should be used.
        Parameters:
        privateKey - a PEM-file containing both a private key and a public key.
        Returns:
        the PEMKeyPair extracted from the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some sort of IOError occurred.
        ECCException - if the file passed could not be decoded to a PEMKeyPair.

      • calculateRandomK

        private static java.math.BigInteger calculateRandomK(java.math.BigInteger lowerLimit,
                                                     java.math.BigInteger upperLimit)
        Creates a random BigInteger inside the provided limits. The limits are inclusive. Could theoretically run into a seemingly endless loop, if every new randomValue is outside of the specified limits. This is highly unlikely but could happen.
        Parameters:
        lowerLimit - the lower boundary of the requested random value (inclusive)
        upperLimit - the upper boundary of the requested random value (inclusive)
        Returns:
        the randomly generated BigInteger

      • sign

        public byte[] sign(byte[] message)
            throws TR_03111_ECC_V2_1_Exception
        The signing operation of the ECDSA class. Uses the BouncyCastle Provider to create a signature.
        Specified by:
        sign in class SignatureAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        message - the value that shall be signed by this algorithm object.
        Returns:
        the signature bytes that are created by signing the input.
        Throws:
        TR_03111_ECC_V2_1_Exception - if the bit length of the digest of the chosen hash function is less than the bit length of the order of the base point of the chosen curve.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] signature,
                      byte[] message)
               throws ECCException,
                      TR_03111_ECC_V2_1_Exception
        Takes a plain text (the notSignedValue) and its supposedly signed counterpart and tries to verify it. Please make sure that this method is given the whole signed value by its caller.
        Specified by:
        verify in class SignatureAlgorithm
        Returns:
        true if the signed value can be verified using the public key of this ecdsa object and the unsigned plaintext.
        Throws:
        ECCException - if something goes wrong with the signature verification.
        TR_03111_ECC_V2_1_Exception

      • getPublicKey

        public org.bouncycastle.jce.interfaces.ECPublicKey getPublicKey()
        Getter method for the public key.
        Specified by:
        getPublicKey in class SignatureAlgorithm
        Returns:
        the public key

      • getAlgorithmDefinition

        public java.lang.String getAlgorithmDefinition()
        Returns a String of the used signature algorithm so it may be used as a key in the Constants.ALGORITHM_OID_MAP. Mainly used by the ERSSpecificModule to compare the algorithm it is using and putting into the log messages to the actual algorithm used to sign those messages.

        Examples:
        "SHA3-512WithECDSA" becomes "ECDSA_PLAIN_SHA3_512"
        "SHA512WithECDSA" becomes "ECDSA_PLAIN_SHA_512"
        Specified by:
        getAlgorithmDefinition in class SignatureAlgorithm

      • getAlgorithmInformation

        public java.lang.String getAlgorithmInformation()
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Returns information about the algorithm, the curve it is using and the hash function.
        Returns:
        - a String in the form of "Algorithm: ECDSA on curve: CURVENAME with hash function SHA/SHA3WithECDSA"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if PropertyValues.getInstance() throws it
